variable.tooltip: Sets the acceleration rate (delay or momentum), 1(default)
variable.label: Accel 1 Rate
Grado Accell.1
variable.tooltip: Progr. grado accellerazione (ritardo o inerzia), valori 0(default)-255
Sets the deceleration rate (delay or momentum), 1(default)
variable.label: Decel 1 Rate
Grado Decell.1
variable.tooltip: Progr. grado decellerazione (ritardo o inerzia), valori 0-255
Lowest speed step (128 SS mode) the loco can go with dynamic brakes turned on
Decel Rate when Dynamic brakes are on
Number of speed steps the loco will slow down per press of the dynamic brake Function
higher number = higher frequency and higher loop counts if a looping sound
variable.label: Random Sound 1 frequency level

variable.tooltip: higher number = higher frequency and higher loop counts if a looping sound

variable.tooltip: higher number = higher frequency and higher loop counts if a looping sound
variable.label: Random Sound 4 frequency level

variable.tooltip: 2560 is about 1 second between times through random sound routine
variable.label: Random Sound Overall Timer

variable.tooltip: The speed at which Random sounds will stop playing (speed of zero stops random sounds from playing)
variable.label: Random Sound Cutout Speed Step

variable.tooltip: for fxns F0F-F14, set bit to have sound and light active in both modes
controls what notch the prime mover goes into when the Dynamic brakes are turned on

at approx this bemf value the decoder should be in notch 1, the decoder assigns this CV during the calibration process but it can be manually overwritten. A value of 0 means the motor is moving with no friction, a value of 255 means the motor is stalled, This is used only in prototype mode
variable.label: BEMF calibration low

variable.tooltip: at approx this bemf value the decoder should be in notch 8, the decoder assigns this CV during the calibration process but it can be manually overwritten. A value of 0 means the motor is moving with no friction, a value of 255 means the motor is stalled, This is used only in prototype mode
variable.label: BEMF calibration high

variable.item: Auto notch down prime mover when brakes are on

variable.label: Function 2 Toggle in Audio Assist
variable.tooltip: Digitrax bit: set simulates button 2 as toggle while in Audio Assist mode

variable.item: Increase in Dynamic Brake power increases throttle notch
variable.tooltip: When the dynamic brakes are on the prime mover goes to notch x, if you increase the db braking power the prime mover notches to x+1, press the DB again and it goes to x+2

variable.label: Reverse Directional Horns
variable.tooltip: If set the directional horns (if enabled) are played in opposite direction from normal, use along with Normal Direction Of Motion setting

variable.include: WOW Diesel Sound Set 1 EMD,WOW Diesel Sound Set 2,WOW Diesel Sound Set 3
variable.tooltip: a value of 256 is about 3 minutes
variable.label: Audio Auto Shut-off Time

variable.exclude: WOW Diesel Sound Set 1 EMD,WOW Diesel Sound Set 2,WOW Diesel Sound Set 3
variable.tooltip: a value of 256 is about 3 minutes
variable.label: Audio Auto Shut-off Time

variable.tooltip: Time delay when the two prime movers notch up, Delay Time in Seconds = Value/2
variable.label: Dual Prime Mover Delay

variable.tooltip: controls how loco speed effects current notch The higher the value the higher the notch will be (in prototype mode)
variable.label: Prototype mode Speed to Notch ratio adjustment

variable.tooltip: adjusts how drastic notch changes are from accelerating/decelerating Higher values means larger notch changes from accel/decel (in prototype mode)
variable.label: Prototype mode momentum effect

variable.tooltip: Controls how BEMF effects prototype mode, this is auto calculated when the user calibrates the engine, but can be manually over written. The higher the value the more effect BEMF has on notching. (in prototype mode)
variable.label: Prototype mode Load (BEMF) adjustment

variable.tooltip: Controls how big of a change is needed in order for the engine to change notches in prototype mode. The higher the value the bigger the change required to make the decoder change notch (in prototype mode)
variable.label: Hysteresis

variable.tooltip: Controls how long the engineer must be idle for the crew alert alarm to sound
variable.label: Crew Alert Timer Reset

variable.tooltip: Determines which light function turns on when the crew alert alarm sounds. Valid Values are 0-12. (Use a value of 13+ to disable the light feature)
variable.label: Crew Alert light function

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 1 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 1 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 2 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 2 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 3 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 3 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 4 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 4 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 5 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 5 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 6 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 6 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 7 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 7 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: Above this value (and below the next notch setpoint) the prime mover will play notch 8 in traditional throttle mode
variable.label: Notch 8 transition speed step

variable.tooltip: The value loaded into CV3 when switch mode is enabled
The value loaded into CV4 when switch mode is enabled
The value loaded into CV3 when main line mode is enabled
The value loaded into CV4 when main line mode is enabled
